page.title: 09Forestry at Sandringham
page.content:
2100 acres of woodland is maintained for commercial purposes, while other sizeable areas are set aside for game, the park and grounds Enough timber is produced for the needs of the estate (posts and rails for fencing, stakes and wood for minor structural work) and the surplus is sold. Hard, high-grade timbers such as oak are sold for furniture making.
{Trees grown}- Scots pine, Corsican pine, larch, Douglas fir, Norway spruce, English oak, Red oak, Sweet chestnut, Beech, Sycamore, Elm and Ash, plus many splendid specimen and ornamental trees.
